edu.mit.jwi.data
Interface IDataSource<T>

All Superinterfaces:
IHasVersion, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BinarySearchWordnetFile, DirectAccessWordnetFile, WordnetFile
public interface IDataSource<T>
extends IHasVersion, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>

Objects that implement this interface mediate between a Dictionary object and the data that is contained in the dictionary data resources. They typically are assigned a name (e.g., verb.data, for the data resource pertaining to verbs) and a content type. A key is used to find a particular piece of data in the resource. The IDataSource object then returns a text string that can be parsed to produce a data object (e.g., an ISynset or IIndexWord object). The iterator produced by this class should not support the Iterator.remove() operation.

Since:
1.5.0
Version:
2.1.5, Nov. 16, 2007
Author:
Mark A. Finlayson

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns a string representation of the name of this resource

getContentType

IContentType<T> getContentType()
Returns the assigned content type of the resource that backs this object.

getLine

java.lang.String getLine(java.lang.String key)
Returns a string that contains the data indexed by the specified key. If the file cannot find the key in its data resource, it returns null

iterator

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator(java.lang.String key)
Returns an iterator that will iterator over lines in the data resource, starting at the line specified by the given key. If the key is null, this is the same as calling the plain Iterable.iterator() method. If no line starts with the pattern, the iterator's Iterator.hasNext() will return false. The iterator does not support the Iterator.remove() operation.
